definition: to get sth open by tapping or striking it/(figuratively, when followed by sth like ∼的大門|∼的大门) to open the door to ~/to gain access to ~
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: So that day she went on her errand of mercy, and knocked at the door of Toad’s cell.
sentences.chinese: 于是有一天，她就敲开蟾蜍囚室的门，去做行善的事。

sentences.english: Crack the eggs and separate yolks from whites, very carefully.
sentences.chinese: 敲开蛋壳，然后小心地把蛋黄从蛋清中分离出来。

sentences.english: When the day came, the ugly girl knocked on the basket-maker's door.
sentences.chinese: 到约定时间时，丑女孩敲开了制篮商的门。

sentences.english: Want in the breeze of the night to marvel, knock to open lonesome heartstring for you.
sentences.chinese: 不要在晚风中惊叹，替你敲开寂寞的心弦。

sentences.english: I hope my love which is as fierce as death, can open your heart.
sentences.chinese: 愿我如死般强烈的爱能敲开你爱的心扉。

sentences.english: Then, he lent to her where to pour water, gently knocking at her door.
sentences.chinese: 于是，他借去她哪里倒水，轻轻地敲开了她的门。

sentences.english: At that point her husband happened to knock on the door.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时她的丈夫正好回来敲开房门。

sentences.english: Flavor A quick blow to the head, and it's lights out.
sentences.chinese: 敲开它的头，吹熄它的生命之光。

sentences.english: Otherwise you may find yourself knocking on the door of some local begging for a gas can.
sentences.chinese: 否则，你只有敲开当地人的大门乞讨一罐汽油。

sentences.english: I actually tried going on movie studio lots and knocking on producer's doors.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我一直都尝试去电影工作室敲开制作人的门。

sentences.english: They came to Sichuan Fine Arts Institute and knocked the door of Zhang Xiaogang who taught there.
sentences.chinese: 她们来到四川美院，敲开了在那教书的张晓刚的门。

sentences.english: All these certifications became useful jetton to knock at the door of good company.
sentences.chinese: 因为这些认证成为敲开优秀公司大门的筹码。

sentences.english: We realized the main barrier to entry is going to be scale.
sentences.chinese: 我们意识到，规模是敲开市场的主要壁垒。

sentences.english: He walked into town, and knocked on the tailor's door.
sentences.chinese: 他走进镇子里，敲开了裁缝家的门。

sentences.english: I prayed no one from school was behind those doors.
sentences.chinese: 我曾祷告我敲开的那些门后不会有我的同学。

definition: entrance/door/gate/large and influential family
the Doors, US rock band

to knock on a door
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
door of a room
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
to burst in
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
to lock/to lock up

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
to sound a bell/to raise the alarm
to rush in/to charge in
to break/to shatter
